alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 8:07PM PDT until May 18 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding during the time of high tide. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet with max sets to 8 feet due to elevated surf. The highest surf is expected along south facing beaches of Los Angeles County. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Ventura County Beaches, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. Minor tidal overflow will also be possible around the time of high tide Friday evening. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely, around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers out to sea. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide this evening: 6.5 ft at 9 PM. High tide Friday: 6.5 ft at 9:30 PM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches
